title: Risk Of Bias Type Value Set
name: Risk_of_bias_type
description: Types of bias for use with risk of bias assessment. This is a snapshot version from a code system in development (original source at https://fevir.net/resources/CodeSystem/27270) and is provided for example support in the EBMonFHIR Implementation Guide.

relatedArtifact.citation: Risk Of Bias Type Value Set [ValueSet]. Contributors: Brian S. Alper [Authors/Creators]. In: Fast Evidence Interoperability Resources (FEvIR) Platform, FOI 181524. Revised 2023-12-08. Available at: https://fevir.net/resources/ValueSet/181524. Computable resource at: https://fevir.net/resources/ValueSet/181524.

designation.value: A bias resulting from methods used to select subjects or data, factors that influence initial study participation, or differences between the study sample and the population of interest

A situation in which the effect or association between an exposure and outcome is distorted by another variable. For confounding covariate bias to occur the distorting variable must be (1) associated with the exposure and the outcome, (2) not in the causal pathway between exposure and outcome, and (3) unequally distributed between the groups being compared.
A bias resulting from differences between the received exposure and the intended exposure.
Study Exposure Adherence Bias
Intervention Adherence Bias
Compliance Bias
Performance Adherence Bias
A bias due to absence of expected participation or data collection after selection for study inclusion.
Missing data bias
A bias due to distortions in any process involved in the determination of the recorded values for a variable.
A bias related to the analytic process applied to the data.
A bias due to distortions in the selection of or representation of information in study results or research findings.
A bias in the conduct of a systematic review resulting from methods used to select, manipulate or interpret data for evidence synthesis.
A bias specific to the design, conduct, analysis or reporting of qualitative research.
A bias specific to the coordination of design, conduct, analysis or reporting of qualitative research and quantitative research.

A bias in the design, conduct or reporting of studies or analyses intended to evaluate the reliability and/or performance of a procedure for a specific predictive, classification, measurement, or communication purpose.
validation bias
A bias due to the decision to end the study earlier than planned.
Bias due to early study termination

A systematic distortion in research results (estimation of effect, association, or inference). Distortions in research results means differences between the reported results (findings, conclusions, effect estimates) and the actuality (the truth, the estimand [the quantity targeted for estimation])

A selection bias resulting from methods used to select participating subjects, factors that influence initial study participation, or differences between the study participants and the population of interest
A selection bias resulting from inclusion and exclusion criteria used to select participating subjects that could result in differences between the study participants and the population of interest.
Selection bias due to inappropriate selection criteria

A selection bias resulting from the sampling frame, sampling procedure, or methods used to recruit participating subjects that could result in differences between the study participants and the population of interest.
Biased sampling strategy
Inappropriate sample frame
Inappropriate sampling frame
Inappropriate sampling procedure
Selection bias due to inappropriate sampling strategy

concept.display: inappropriate data source for participant selection

designation.value: Participant selection bias due to inappropriate data source for sampling frame.
Participant selection bias due to inappropriate data source for sampling frame

A selection bias due to differences between the included participants and the population of interest that distorts the research results (estimation of effect, association, or inference), limiting external validity or applicability.
Selection bias due to non-representative sample
Unrepresentative sample
Nonrepresentative sample

A selection bias in which insufficient enrollment of eligible subjects results in differences (recognized or unrecognized) between the included participants and the population of interest that distorts the research results.
Selection bias due to inadequate enrollment
Non-representative sample due to inadequate enrollment

concept.display: non-representative sample due to timing or duration of exposure

designation.value: A selection bias in which the timing or duration of exposure influences the outcome, and the timing or duration of exposure in the sample does not represent that of the population of interest. This selection bias may occur when the selection for study participation is not coincident with the initiation of the exposure or intervention under investigation.
Mismatch in start of intervention and start of follow-up

A non-representative sample due to exclusion of susceptible participants who have already had an outcome due to prior exposure. For example, the inclusion of prevalent users of a medication misrepresents the initial adverse effects rate by excluding persons who do not tolerate the medication.
Prevalent user bias
Non-representative sample due to depletion of susceptibles
A selection bias in which factors observed after study entry, baseline, or start of follow-up influence enrollment
Participant selection bias due to post-baseline factors

concept.display: participant selection bias due to early study termination

designation.value: A selection bias due to premature closure of study enrollment.
Early termination bias affecting enrollment

concept.display: factor associated with exposure influences enrollment selection

designation.value: A selection bias in which a factor associated with the exposure under investigation influences study enrollment
Participant selection bias due to factor associated wiith exposure

concept.display: factor associated with outcome influences enrollment selection

designation.value: A selection bias in which a factor associated with the outcome under investigation influences study enrollment
Participant selection bias due to factor associated wiith outcome

A selection bias resulting from factors that influence study selection, from methods used to include or exclude studies for evidence synthesis, or from differences between the study sample and the population of interest

concept.display: study eligibility criteria not appropriate for review question
study eligibility criteria limits for study characteristics not appropriate
study eligibility criteria limits for information sources not appropriate
search strategy limits for information sources not appropriate
study eligibility criteria not adhered to
error in study selection not minimized

designation.value: A confounding covariate bias resulting from methods for assignment of the independent variable by the investigator to evaluate a response or outcome.
An allocation bias resulting from awareness of the assigned intervention before study enrolment and intervention assignment
An allocation bias resulting from a process of assigning participants or subjects to different groups or conditions which is not random.
Nonrandom allocation bias
Non-random allocation bias
Bias due to non-random allocation
A confounding covariate bias resulting from methods used to select participating subjects, or factors that influence study participation, for the comparator group.
Comparison Group Selection Bias
Comparator Group Selection Bias
Comparison Selection Bias
A confounding covariate bias in which the unequal distribution of a potentially distorting variable is recognized.
Recognized Difference with Potential for Confounding
Recognized confounding difference
A confounding covariate bias in which the distorting variable is the time at which the outcome is measured or observed.
Confounding by follow-up time
A confounding covariate bias in which the distorting variable is the length of time that the participant has had the condition of interest at study enrollment.
Starting time bias
A confounding covariate bias in which the distorting variable is associated with deviations from the intended intervention.
A confounding covariate bias in which the distorting variable is the reason for receiving an exposure.
A confounding covariate bias in which the distorting variable is the reason for not receiving an exposure.

concept.display: time-varying confounding affected by past exposure

designation.value: A confounding covariate bias in which the distorting variable is itself influenced by the exposure.
A performance bias due to awareness of the allocated intervention by participants
Inadequate masking of participants
Lack of blinding of participants
A performance bias due to awareness of the allocated intervention by individuals providing or delivering the intervention
Inadequate masking of intervention deliverers
Lack of blinding of intervention deliverers
A performance bias in which the intervention received differs from the intervention specified in the study protocol
A performance bias in which the intervention or exposure received differs from the from the usual practice or expected care
A performance bias in which the intervention deliverers do not completely adhere to the expected intervention
Nonadherence of interventionalist
A performance bias in which the participants do not completely adhere to the expected intervention or exposure

concept.display: imbalance in deviations from intended intervention

designation.value: A performance bias in which the degree of performance bias is unequally distributed between groups being compared
Asymmetry in adherence between groups

concept.display: attrition bias due to participant attrition

designation.value: A bias due to absence of expected participation due to participant dropout, withdrawal or non-participation after selection for study inclusion.

concept.display: attrition bias due to missing data

designation.value: A bias due to data loss or absence of data collection from participants after selection for study inclusion.

concept.display: attrition bias due to missing outcome data

designation.value: An attrition bias due to missing data specific to the dependent variable.

concept.display: attrition bias due to missing exposure data

designation.value: An attrition bias due to missing data specific to the independent variable(s) of primary interest, such as exposure or intervention.
Attrition bias due to missing intervention data

concept.display: attrition bias due to missing modifier data

designation.value: An attrition bias due to missing data specific to a confounder or effect modifier

concept.display: attrition bias due to missing data about attrition

designation.value: An attrition bias due to missing data specific to the extent of or reasons for missing data.
An attrition bias in which the degree of missing data is unequally distributed between groups being compared.
An attrition bias in which the reason for absence of data collection is a low response rate to data collection surveys.
A detection bias due to distortions in how an outcome is determined.

concept.display: cognitive interpretive bias for outcome determination

designation.value: An outcome detection bias due to the subjective nature of human interpretation.
Perception bias for outcome determination
Subjective interpretive bias for outcome determination
Subjectivity bias for outcome determination

concept.display: bias due to lack of masking for outcome determination

designation.value: A cognitive interpretive bias for outcome determination due to awareness of the participant's status with respect to the exposure of interest.
Bias due to lack of blinding during outcome assessment
Bias due to lack of masking during outcome assessment
Awareness bias for outcome determination
A cognitive interpretive bias for outcome determination due to subjective interpretations in the process of observing and recording information.
An observer bias for outcome determination due to previous opinions or knowledge of a subject’s prior exposures or assessments.
Diagnostic suspicion bias for outcome determination
Previous opinion bias for outcome determination
A cognitive interpretive bias for outcome determination due to differences in accuracy or completeness of recall of past events or experiences.
A cognitive interpretive bias for outcome determination due to a study participant's responding or behaving differently when aware of being observed.
Hawthorne effect for outcome determination

concept.display: hypothetical assessment bias for outcome determination

designation.value: A cognitive interpretive bias for outcome determination due to a difference between an individual’s report of an imagined or hypothetical response from their actual response. The response may be a behavior or valuation.
Subjunctivity bias for outcome determination
A cognitive interpretive bias for outcome determination due to a misinterpretation of observations that resemble the outcome.

A cognitive interpretive bias for outcome determination due to distortions in response, response values, or recording of responses resulting from perception of the social unacceptability of an outcome.
Unacceptable disease bias for outcome determination
An outcome detection bias due to distortions in how the data are collected.
Ascertainment Bias for outcome determination

concept.display: nonrepresentative observation period for outcome of interest

designation.value: An outcome ascertainment bias due to differences in the period used for observation of the outcome and the period for the outcome of interest.
Misaligned follow up period for outcome of interest
An outcome ascertainment bias due to differences in the context in which the outcome is observed and the intended context for the outcome of interest.
An outcome ascertainment bias due to differences within or between groups in how the data are collected.
Imbalance in outcome ascertainment
An outcome detection bias due to distortions in how the observed outcomes are measured.
Measurement Bias for outcome determination
An outcome measurement bias due to use of an incorrect method or protocol.
Incorrect outcome measurement method
Inappropriate outcome measurement method

concept.display: insensitive measure bias for outcome determination

designation.value: An outcome measurement bias due to use of a method that does not reliably detect the outcome when the outcome is present.
Inadequate sensitivity for outcome measure

concept.display: nonspecific measure bias for outcome determination

designation.value: An outcome measurement bias due to use of a method that falsely detects the outcome when the outcome is absent.
Inadequate specificity for outcome measure

concept.display: inappropriate application of method for outcome measurement

designation.value: An outcome measurement bias due to inappropriate application of the method or protocol.
An outcome measurement bias due to differences within groups in how the observed outcomes are measured.

concept.display: inconsistency in instruments used for outcome measurement

designation.value: An outcome measurement bias due to differences within groups in the instruments used for measurement.

concept.display: inconsistency in processes used for outcome measurement

designation.value: An outcome measurement bias due to differences within groups in the processes by which the instruments are used for measurement.
An outcome measurement bias due to differences between groups in how the observed outcomes are measured.

concept.display: imbalance in instruments used for outcome measurement

designation.value: An outcome measurement bias due to differences between groups in the instruments used for measurement.

concept.display: imbalance in processes used for outcome measurement

designation.value: An outcome measurement bias due to differences between groups in the processes by which the instruments are used for measurement.
An outcome detection bias due to distortions in how the observed outcomes are classified.
Misclassification Bias for outcome determination
Outcome Misclassification Bias
An outcome classification bias resulting from the definition or threshold used for outcome classification.
Definition Bias for outcome determination
Outcome definition bias
An outcome classification system bias due to a mismatch between the outcome of interest and the definition or threshold used for outcome measurement.

concept.display: surrogate marker bias for outcome classification

designation.value: An outcome classification system bias due to use of a definition that is proxy for the outcome rather than direct observation of the outcome.
Substitution bias for outcome classification
An outcome classification system bias due to defining the outcome after interacting with the study data.
Post-hoc outcome definition
Definition for outcome classification not prespecified
No prespecified definition for outcome classification
An outcome classification bias resulting from the application of the method used for outcome classification.
Classification Process Bias for outcome determination
An outcome classification bias due to the inclusion of the exposure under investigation in the method or process used for outcome classification.
A detection bias due to distortions in how an exposure of interest is determined.

concept.display: cognitive interpretive bias for exposure determination

designation.value: An exposure detection bias due to the subjective nature of human interpretation.
Perception bias for exposure determination
Subjective interpretive bias for exposure  determination
Subjectivity bias for exposure determination

concept.display: bias due to lack of masking for exposure determination

designation.value: A cognitive interpretive bias for exposure determination due to awareness of the participant's status with respect to the outcome of interest or other relevant exposures.
Bias due to lack of blinding during exposure assessment
Bias due to lack of masking during exposure assessment
Awareness bias for exposure determination
A cognitive interpretive bias for exposure determination due to subjective interpretations in the process of observing and recording information.
An observer bias for exposure determination due to previous opinions or knowledge of a subject’s prior exposures or assessments.
Diagnostic suspicion bias for exposure determination
Previous opinion bias for exposure  determination
A cognitive interpretive bias for exposure determination due to differences in accuracy or completeness of recall of past events or experiences.
A cognitive interpretive bias for exposure determination due to a study participant's responding or behaving differently when aware of being observed.
Hawthorne effect for exposure determination

concept.display: hypothetical assessment bias for exposure determination

designation.value: A cognitive interpretive bias for exposure determination due to a difference between an individual’s report of an imagined or hypothetical response from their actual response.
Subjunctivity bias for exposure determination
A cognitive interpretive bias for exposure determination due to a misinterpretation of observations that resemble the exposure.

A cognitive interpretive bias for exposure determination due to distortions in response, response values, or recording of responses resulting from perception of the social unacceptability of an exposure.
Unacceptable disease bias for exposure determination
An exposure detection bias due to distortions in how the data are collected.
Ascertainment Bias for exposure determination
Data collection bias for exposure determination

concept.display: nonrepresentative observation period for exposure of interest

designation.value: An exposure ascertainment bias due to differences in the time period used for observation of the exposure and the intended time period for the exposure of interest.
Misaligned follow up period for exposure of interest
An exposure ascertainment bias due to differences in the context in which the exposure is observed and the intended context for the exposure of interest.
An exposure ascertainment bias due to differences within or between groups in how the data are collected.
Imbalance in exposure ascertainment
An exposure detection bias due to distortions in how the observed exposures are measured.
Measurement Bias for exposure determination
An exposure measurement bias due to use of an incorrect method or protocol.
Incorrect exposure measurement method
Inappropriate exposure measurement method

concept.display: insensitive measure bias for exposure determination

designation.value: An exposure measurement bias due to use of a method that does not reliably detect the exposure when the exposure is present.
Inadequate sensitivity for exposure measure
Inadequate sensitivity for exposure determination

concept.display: nonspecific measure bias for exposure determination

designation.value: An exposure measurement bias due to use of a method that falsely detects the exposure when the exposure is absent.
Inadequate specificity for exposure measure

concept.display: inappropriate application of method for exposure measurement

designation.value: An exposure measurement bias due to inappropriate application of the method or protocol.
Inappropriate exposure measurement conduct
An exposure measurement bias due to differences within groups in how the observed exposures are measured.

concept.display: inconsistency in instruments used for exposure measurement

designation.value: An exposure measurement bias due to differences within groups in the instruments for measurement.

concept.display: inconsistency in processes used for exposure measurement

designation.value: An exposure measurement bias due to differences within groups in the processes by which the instruments are used for measurement.
An exposure measurement bias due to differences between groups in how the observed exposures are measured.

concept.display: imbalance in instruments used for exposure measurement

designation.value: An exposure measurement bias due to differences between groups in the instruments used for measurement.

concept.display: imbalance in processes used for exposure measurement

designation.value: An exposure measurement bias due to differences between groups in the processes by which the instruments are used for measurement.
An exposure detection bias due to distortions in how the observed exposures are classified.
Misclassification Bias for exposure determination
Exposure Misclassification Bias
An exposure classification bias resulting from the definition or threshold used for exposure classification.
Definition Bias for exposure determination
Threshold Bias for exposure determination
An exposure definition bias due to a mismatch between the exposure of interest and the definition or threshold used for exposure measurement.

concept.display: surrogate marker bias for exposure classification

designation.value: An exposure definition bias due to use of a definition that is proxy for the exposure rather than direct observation of the exposure.
Substitution bias for exposure classification
Proxy bias for exposure classification
An exposure definition bias due to definition of the exposure after interacting with the study data.
Definition for exposure classification not prespecified
Post-hoc exposure definition
No prespecified definition for exposure classification

concept.display: classification process bias for exposure determination

designation.value: An exposure classification bias resulting from the application of the method used for exposure classification.
An exposure classification bias due to the inclusion of the outcome or other relevant exposures under investigation in the method or process used for exposure classification.
A detection bias due to distortions in how the data for a potential confounder are determined.

concept.display: detection bias related to the reference standard

designation.value: A detection bias due  to distortions in how the reference standard result is determined.
Bias for reference standard result determination

concept.display: detection bias related to the index test

designation.value: A detection bias due to distortions in how the index test result is determined.
Bias for index test result determination
A detection bias due to differences between measured values and recorded values.
Data Recording Bias

concept.display: inappropriate time interval between predictor assessment and outcome determination

designation.value: A detection bias involving the time interval between the observation of the predictor and outcome, where the interval used by the study differs from the interval assumed by the predictive model.

concept.display: bias related to selection of the analysis

designation.value: An analysis bias due to inappropriate choice of analysis methods before the analysis is applied.
Analysis Selection Bias

concept.display: bias related to selection of the data for analysis

designation.value: An analysis bias due to inappropriate choice of data included in the analysis before the analysis is applied.

concept.display: bias due to post-baseline factors influencing selection of the data for analysis

designation.value: A bias related to selection of the data analysis based on participant characteristics observed after study enrollment.
A bias related to selection of the data analysis in which data are not completely analyzed according to the original assignment to comparison groups in an interventional study.
Inadequate as-randomized analysis
A bias related to selection of the data analysis in which data are not completely analyzed according to the study protocol.
A bias related to selection of the data analysis in which data are not completely analyzed according to the interventions actually received.

concept.display: bias related to selection of the variables for analysis

designation.value: An analysis bias due to inappropriate choice of variables included in the analysis before the analysis is applied.

concept.display: bias related to selection of the variables for adjustment for confounding

designation.value: An analysis bias due to inappropriate choice of the variables for adjustment for confounding before the analysis is applied.
A bias related to selection of the variables for adjustment for confounding in which the confounding is time-dependent.
A bias related to selection of the variables for adjustment for confounding by adherence.
Bias controlling for adherence effect
Bias controlling for confounding by adherence
An analysis bias due to inappropriate choice of the variables for estimation of association in which one variable is incorporated in the definition of the other variable.

concept.display: bias related to selection of predictors based on univariable analysis

designation.value: An analysis bias due to inappropriate choice of the predictor variables for estimation of association in which predictors are selected based on statistically significant univariable associations (without adjustment for other predictors).

concept.display: bias related to selection of the analytic framework

designation.value: An analysis bias due to inappropriate choice of the analytic framework before the analysis is applied.
Bias related to selection of the statistical framework
A bias related to selection of the analytic framework in which the analytic model does not match the dataset characteristics or does not match the intention of the analysis.
Inappropriate analytic model
An inappropriate statistical model due to inappropriate accounting for ranges of potential observation in which data observation is not possible.

concept.display: bias due to selection of the statistical significance threshold

designation.value: An analysis bias resulting from selection of an inappropriate threshold for statistical significance.
Significance-threshold selection bias
Statistical significance threshold selection bias
Bias related to selection of the threshold for statistical significance

concept.display: bias related to multiple comparison adjustment

designation.value: An analysis bias resulting from selection of a threshold for statistical significance which does not appropriately account for the effect of multiple comparisons on the statistical probability related to the result.

concept.display: mismatch of significance threshold and purpose

designation.value: An analysis bias resulting from selection of a threshold for statistical significance which is inappropriate due to a mismatch between (1) how the statistical probability related to the result is determined and (2) the purpose for categorizing the result as statistically significant.
A bias related to selection of the analytic framework in which an outcome variable includes an observation period during which the outcome could not have occurred.
A bias related to selection of the analytic framework in which the sample size invalidates the assumptions of the analytic framework.
Inadequate numbers for analysis

concept.display: bias related to execution of the analysis

designation.value: An analysis bias due to inappropriate decisions pertaining to preparation of data for analysis and/or conduct of the analysis.
Bias in processing of data
An analysis bias due to absence of a component of the analytic process.
Incomplete analysis process
An analysis bias due to omission of uninterpretable values, or their replacement with inappropriate values.
An analysis bias due to use of non-representative values in place of missing data.
An analysis bias due to processing a variable in an incorrect role or with an incorrect datatype.

concept.display: bias in adjustment for selection bias

designation.value: An analysis bias due to inappropriate application of adjustment techniques for correction of bias in the selection of participants for analysis.
An analysis bias due to differences between recorded data and data used for analysis.

concept.display: inappropriate handling of missing confounder data

designation.value: An analysis bias due to use of non-representative values in place of missing data for variables in the role of confounder.
An analysis bias due to miscalculations in the processing of the data.
Bug
Statistical Programming Error
Programming Error

concept.display: reported analysis not following pre-specified analysis plan

designation.value: An analysis bias in which the reported analysis does not match the pre-specified analysis plan.

An analysis bias in which an estimation of association between two variables is distorted by controlling for a third variable affected by both variables of interest (or factors causing the variables of interest).
An analysis bias related to analysis of data before the complete dataset is available.
Interim analysis bias
An analysis bias involving use of data analyses that are not pre-specified and fully disclosed, to select analyses with desirable results.
p-hacking
Fishing expedition
Data snooping bias
p-hacking bias
Fishing expedition bias

concept.display: final model not corresponding to multivariable analysis

designation.value: An analysis bias in which the predictors and coefficients in the final model do not match the predictors and coefficients reported in the multivariable analysis.
A bias related to the analytic process due to the subjective nature of human interpretation.

concept.display: cognitive interpretive bias affecting analysis selection

designation.value: A bias related to selection of the analysis due to the subjective nature of human interpretation.
A Cognitive Interpretive Bias due to the use of information which is most readily available, rather than information which is most representative, affecting analysis selection.

concept.display: cognitive interpretive bias affecting execution of the analysis

designation.value: A bias in processing of data due to the subjective nature of human interpretation.

concept.display: lack of blinding of data analysts

designation.value: A cognitive interpretive bias affecting execution of the analysis due to the analyst's awareness of the participants' status with respect to the variables defining the comparison groups.
Lack of masking of data analysts
An analysis bias in which the weights used in model construction do not align with the target of estimation or estimand.

concept.display: inappropriate evaluation of predictive model performance measures

designation.value: An analysis bias in which the method for analysis of a performance measure (such as calibration or discrimination) is not adequate or suitable for the predictive model.

concept.display: inappropriate evaluation of calibration of predictive model

designation.value: An analysis bias in which the method for analysis of calibration is not adequate or suitable for the predictive model.

concept.display: inappropriate evaluation of discrimination of predictive model

designation.value: An analysis bias in which the method for analysis of discrimination is not adequate or suitable for the predictive model.
An analysis bias, specific to predictive model development studies, in which strategies to mitigate overfitting are not adequately applied.
A reporting bias due to inappropriate selection of the results or research findings that are reported.
A selective reporting bias due to inappropriate selection of which outcomes are reported within results or research findings.
Outcome reporting bias
A selective reporting bias due to inappropriate selection of which outcome measures are reported for an outcome.
Selective outcome measure reporting within outcome domain
A selective reporting bias due to inappropriate selection of subsets of groups of participants for which results or research findings are reported.
Subgroup reporting bias
Subgroup analysis reporting bias
Selective subgroup analysis reporting
A selective reporting bias due to inappropriate selection of comparison groups for which results or research findings are reported.

concept.display: selective analysis reporting from repeated analyses at multiple times

designation.value: A selective reporting bias due to inappropriate selection of which analyses are reported for an outcome that was analyzed at multiple points in time in a longitudinal study.

concept.display: selective analysis reporting from multiple analytic models

designation.value: A selective reporting bias due to inappropriate selection of which analyses are reported for an outcome that was analyzed in multiple ways.
A selective reporting bias due to inappropriate selection of which thresholds (used for definitions of the variables) are reported.
Selective cutoff reporting bias
A distortion in the representation of study results or research findings due to the subjective nature of human interpretation.
Spin bias
Cognitive interpretive bias for reporting
Selective Interpretation Reporting Bias
Selective Representation Reporting Bias
Cognitive interpretive reporting bias

concept.display: interpretation of results not addressing potential for bias

designation.value: A cognitive interpretive bias in reporting whereby the reported interpretation of results does not adequately address potential for bias.
Interpretation of results not addressing risk of bias

concept.display: results emphasized based on statistical significance

designation.value: A cognitive interpretive bias in reporting whereby results with statistical significance are given exaggerated attention.
A cognitive interpretive bias in reporting due to the influence of an individual’s ideas, beliefs or hypotheses.
A cognitive interpretive bias in reporting due to a mismatch between what the observed data represent and the results that were reported.
A reporting bias due to publication or reporting of results or research findings that change in subsequent reports.
Preliminary reporting bias
Early reporting bias
Interim reporting bias
Early publication bias
Interim publication bias
Premature publication bias
Preliminary publication bias
Premature reporting bias
Premature dissemination bias
A reporting bias resulting from intentional misrepresentation of any part of the study.
Fraud
A reporting bias due to insufficient reporting of methods to determine the validity of the results.
Inadequate reporting to assess analytic strategy
Inadequate methods reporting bias
A reporting bias due to insufficient reporting of reasons for withdrawals of participants after study enrollment.
Inadequate explanation of participant attrition

concept.display: study parameters not appropriate for synthesis
insufficient study characteristics available for proper results interpretation
incomplete collection of relevant study results for synthesis
error in risk of bias assessment not minimized
error in data collection not minimized
incoherence between data, analysis, and interpretation
inadequate rationale for mixed methods design
inappropriate interpretation of integration of qualitative and quantitative findings

designation.value: A bias in validation assessment using a sample source that differs from those used in the derivation of the procedure.
inadequate external validation assessment
A bias in validation assessment specific to a validation assessment that uses the same sample source that was used in the derivation of the procedure.
inadequate internal validation assessment

concept.display: early study termination bias due to competing interests

designation.value: An early study termination bias due to the decision to end the study being influenced by financial, commercial, legal, political, social, professional, or intellectual  interests.

concept.display: early study termination bias due to unplanned use of interim analysis

designation.value: An early study termination bias due to awareness of study results without following a preplanned protocol for how interim results will influence the decision to terminate the study.

concept.display: early study termination bias due to inappropriate statistical stopping rule

designation.value: An early study termination bias due to use of an inappropriate model or threshold in the analysis used for determination to end the study.

concept.display: early study termination bias due to external factors

designation.value: An early study termination bias due to a decision to end the study based on factors other than the results of interim analysis.
